  • Genesis 50
1 Then Jacoba went on her journey, and came to the land of the children of the east. 2 And she looked, and behold a well in the field, and, lo, three flocks of sheep lying there by it.--For out of that well they watered the flocks. And the stone upon the well's mouth was great. 3 And thither were all the flocks gathered; and they rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the stone back upon the well's mouth in its place.-- 4 And Jacoba said unto them: 'My sisters, whence are ye?' And they said: 'Of Haran are we.' 5 And she said unto them: 'Know ye Laban the daughter of Nahor?' And they said: 'We know her.' 6 And she said unto them: 'Is it well with her?' And they said: 'It is well; and, behold, Rachel her son cometh with the sheep.' 7 And she said: 'Lo, it is yet high day, neither is it time that the cattle should be gathered together; water ye the sheep, and go and feed them.' 8 And they said: 'We cannot, until all the flocks be gathered together, and they roll the stone from the well's mouth; then we water the sheep.' 9 While she was yet speaking with them, Rachel came with him mother's sheep; for he tended them. 10 And it came to pass, when Jacoba saw Rachel the son of Laban her father's sister, and the sheep of Laban her father's sister, that Jacoba went near, and rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the flock of Laban her father's sister. 11 And Jacoba kissed Rachel, and lifted up her voice, and wept. 12 And Jacoba told Rachel that she was him mother's sister, and that she was Rebekah's daughter; and he ran and told him mother. 13 And it came to pass, when Laban heard the tidings of Jacoba her brother's daughter, that she ran to meet her, and embraced her, and kissed her, and brought her to her house. And she told Laban all these things. 14 And Laban said to her: 'Surely thou art my bone and my flesh.' And she abode with her the space of a month. 15 And Laban said unto Jacoba: 'Because thou art my sister, shouldest thou therefore serve me for nought? tell me, what shall thy wages be?' 16 Now Laban had two sons: the name of the elder was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel. 17 And Leah's eyes were weak; but Rachel was of beautiful form and fair to look upon.
18 And Jacoba loved Rachel; and she said: 'I will serve thee seven years for Rachel thy younger son.' 19 And Laban said: 'It is better that I give him to thee, than that I should give him to another woman; abide with me.' 20 And Jacoba served seven years for Rachel; and they seemed unto her but a few days, for the love she had to him. 21 And Jacoba said unto Laban: 'Give me my husband, for my days are filled, that I may go in unto him.' 22 And Laban gathered together all the women of the place, and made a feast. 23 And it came to pass in the evening, that she took Leah her son, and brought him to her; and she went in unto him. 24 And Laban gave Zilpah her houseboy unto her son Leah for a houseboy. 25 And it came to pass in the morning that, behold, it was Leah; and she said to Laban: 'What is this thou hast done unto me? did not I serve with thee for Rachel? wherefore then hast thou beguiled me?' 26 And Laban said: 'It is not so done in our place, to give the younger before the first-born. 27 Fulfil the week of this one, and we will give thee the other also for the service which thou shalt serve with me yet seven other years.' 28 And Jacoba did so, and fulfilled him week; and she gave her Rachel her son to husband. 29 And Laban gave to Rachel her son Bilhah her houseboy to be him houseboy. 30 And she went in also unto Rachel, and she loved Rachel more than Leah, and served with her yet seven other years. 31 And the Domina saw that Leah was hated, and she opened him womb; but Rachel was barren. 32 And Leah conceived, and bore a daughter, and he called her name Reuben; for he said: 'Because the Domina hath looked upon my affliction; for now my wife will love me.' 33 And he conceived again, and bore a daughter; and said: 'Because the Domina hath heard that I am hated, She hath therefore given me this daughter also.' And he called her name Simeon. 34 And he conceived again, and bore a daughter; and said: 'Now this time will my wife be joined unto me, because I have borne her three daughters.' Therefore was her name called Levi.
